lexUnit.name: astounding.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: shocking, or causing great surprise

sentence.text: The 11 tourists , with a lot of help from the four friends who made up last night 's team , gave an astounding display to inflict on France their first defeat here for seven years .
The astounding point about the Polgar phenomenon is that Laszlo Polgar planned such results before the children were born .
` Battling Barry Neal won an astounding legal victory yesterday -- giving viewers the right to watch Sky TV without a telly licence… `
Crisp was putting in an astounding performance .
` Well , I 've got some rather astounding news for you , Gilly . "
The finished results are without doubt quite astounding .
Kasparov sacrificed his queen for just bishop , knight and pawn , an astounding conception which will fuel debate amongst chess theoreticians for years to come .
But what he lacked in build he made up for in speed and skill , nipping in and out of solid defences with astounding ease .
In his opening game he scored twice in a 6-2 victory over Manchester United and continued to score with astounding regularity throughout the season .

Many people might prefer Bartók 's First Violin Concerto , the obvious and most suitable coupling , but Norbert Moret 's Violin Concerto of 1988 , written for Mutter , receives a quite astounding performance .
ROBBEN FORD It 's a case of “ any colour you like as long as it 's blues ” on this astounding musician 's new album …
He did not flinch from declaring ` I say to you " and then made astounding claims about himself .
He would disappear into the Orient for months , regularly sending back shiploads of jewellery , pottery , textiles and works of art , of exotic styles and astounding quality .
But Christopher was playing happily in hospital last night after making an astounding recovery .
` He was just astounding , miraculous , " says Peter Hall .
But if you swim only during the day , you will hardly ever see the organisms that have created this astounding scene .
Others , in one of the most astounding forms of social behaviour , make slaves of a different kind of ant .
His eyes were an astounding blue and his complexion was ruddy from a life spent mostly at sea .
We watched as flocks swirled over the Park 's outer perimeter , performing astounding aerial manoevrings .
The boy threw out his arm at astounding speed and touched her face .
Then she thought about Piers , seeing his nudity as he stepped into the bath with astounding clarity .
For one thing it gives me the opportunity to write to you , and also I must have time to draw breath and come to terms with this astounding piece of good fortune that has befallen me .
The performance of computers improves at an astounding rate , perhaps unlike any other machine in the world .
The sets looked beautiful , reminiscent of Turner 's ` January " Scottish pictures , and Lucia was deemed an astounding success .
